About Me

I’m working in the Cloud Enablement team as a Senior Cloud Architect. I’m an AWS Certied Solutions Architect - Professional, Certied Developer and Certied SysOps Administrator. I’m also Google Cloud Certified trainer, Google Cloud Certified - Professional Cloud Architect and Azure certified (exam 70-533). I’m interested in cloud native solutions and all aspects of the cloud from infrastructure to applications.

I am continuously learning and updating myself with stamp of certifications on the latest pursuing technology

Eficode

https://www.eficode.com/home

Cloud Architect

February, 2018 - Octuber, 2018

We deliver change

I am involve in planning, specifying, implementation, consultation, support, testing and maintenance of software and IT systems as well as consultative work related to improving customer’s tools and practices related to software creation. My area of work also includes customer management responsibilities such as contract negotiations, technical sales work and planning of existing work related to customers and tasks within the consults area of expertise.

I am currently involve in complete migration of an existing on-prem (hetzner) based application to AWS, for a leading, online, Danish sports company that servers over 15 million request per day. AWS services used in project:

  • IAM: identity and access management
  • Codepipeline: Continuous delivery pipeline
  • Codebuild: Execute build and test (like Jenkin)
  • Codecommit: version control
  • Cloudformation: Infrastructure and resources definition (infra as code) + deployment
  • Lambda: Serverless code compute: to resize images, run small tasks
  • EC2 + EBS: Virtual machines to run/autoscale the web server
  • VPC: Virtual private cloud: networking, security, subnets, route table for EC2 instances
  • Application Load Balancer (ALB): Load balance traffic from clients (mobile, browser) to web servers
  • Cloudfront (content delivery network): Caching and distribute content to clients (mobile, browser)
  • S3: Store static contents, resized images, CI/CD built artifacts
  • API gateway: Invoke lambda to resize image
  • Cloudwatch: Logs, metrics, alarm
  • SNS: Simple notification service: notification (email, slack message)
  • Route53: For domain name system
  • Systems Manager Parameter Store: Secure storage for credentials
  • Aurora: relational database service: Run the mysql database
  • Key management service (KMS): Key to encrypt storage, parameter store credentials
  • AWS Config: Assess, audit, and evaluate the configurations of AWS resources
  • AWS certificate manager: Free SSL certificate for load balancer

Projects

App42PaaS

http://app42paas.shephertz.com/

App42 PaaS is a Public Cloud Platform-as-a-Service with support for multiple languages and platforms. This will enable you to focus on your development rather than putting your time on infrastructure hassles.

Key Benefits:

  • A Polyglot platform that supports multiple languages and frameworks like Ruby, Java, PHP, Node.js, JRuby, Jython and more.
  • Multiple Cloud Services like MongoDB, CouchDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL and more.
  • Control through Command Line as well as Management Console for quick deployment of Apps
  • Customizable load balancing for high availability- Quick Scaling/Descaling of resources

App42API

http://api.shephertz.com/

The App42 Cloud API’s consists of a REST based service which has a JSON and XML interface. There are around 22+ modules with over 400+ API’s e.g. User, Session Management, Storage, Recommendation, Photo Gallery, Queue / Message, Game, Geo Spatial etc. which will help developers to develop their applications; irrespective of the type of App they are developing. SDK’s are provided for all popular languages and platforms which will enable easy integration of the API’s into the App code. With just a few lines of code, the App developer gets access to services from a simple to complex technical as well as business services.

Social Cheers

https://www.socialcheers.com/

Social cheers is a VIP experience offered at many upscale venues. With the purchase of bottle service, the venue provides you with your own private table, booth, skybox or VIP room where you and your guests are presented with a complete bottle of spirits for your consumption accompanied with a variety of mixers; usually cranberry juice, orange juice, seltzer and tonic limes and lemons etc. Typically, your drinks are served table-side by a personal waitress and you (or your server will) make whatever mix you’d like until you run out.In almost every case, the purchase of bottle service permits you and your guests to bypass lines and cover fees associated with that venue. Depending on the venue, there is usually a limit of 1-6 persons per bottle and in some venues, there maybe a two bottle minimum purchase required. Bottle service is many times purchased to celebrate the great moments of life such as; Birthdays, Bachelorette/Bachelor Parties, Anniversaries, Engagements, Promotions and other special occasions. However, many people also purchase bottle service spontaneously to simply enjoy the night out with friends.
